p: The human epidemiological time series presented in Figure 1 is the death rates attributed to pneumonia and influenza reported in the United States [54]. This measure is known to correlate with human influenza activity [54], enabling qualitative description of population-wide influenza transmission. The subtype dominance patterns focus also on the United States and have been estimated through an annual sampling performed by the Center for Disease Control and Prevention [4]. Avian epidemiological time series and subtype dominance has focused on a duck population sampled in Alberta, Canada [55].
